required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Observational Study With Investigation of Two Second Generation Laryngeal Masks
clinical_study.official_title: Supraglottic Airways LMA Supreme and Ambu AuraGain in Clinical Practice: a Prospective Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: In a observational study the second-generation laryngeal masks LMA Supreme and Ambu AuraGain are investigated.

detailed_description.textblock: After approval from the local ethics committee, data were collected in a prospective, non- randomised study over a three-month period. When contra-indications for laryngeal mask use were absent anaesthesiologists used either Supreme (Teleflex Medical GmbH, Germany) or Gain (Ambu GmbH, Germany). Endpoints were the success rate and time to insertion.

primary_outcome.description: overall and first attempt success rate

arm_group.description: Measuring Success rate and Insertion Time
Measuring Success rate and Insertion Time

intervention.description: Success rate and time for insertion

study_pop.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
Age > 18 Years informed consent elective surgery undergoing general anesthesia non-pregnant

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 18 Years
- No concurrent participation in another study
- capacity to consent
- Present written informed consent of the research participant
- Elective surgery under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age <18 years
- Existing pregnancy
- Lack of consent
- inability to consent
- emergency patients
- Emergency situations in the context of a Difficult Airway Management
- ASA classification> 3
- situations where the possibility of accumulated gastric contents
- Participation in another study

results_reference.citation: Russo SG, Cremer S, Galli T, Eich C, Bräuer A, Crozier TA, Bauer M, Strack M. Randomized comparison of the i-gel™, the LMA Supreme™, and the Laryngeal Tube Suction-D using clinical and fibreoptic assessments in elective patients. BMC Anesthesiol. 2012 Aug 7;12:18. doi: 10.1186/1471-2253-12-18.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Marc Kriege, MD; Rüdiger Noppens, MD
